title: Test
yAxis: Number of children born per woman
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of children born per woman, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall Number of children born per woman has decreased over the Year.
Number of children born per woman is gradually decreasing from 2007 to 2012, roughly constant from 2012 to 2016, and lastly roughly decreasing from 2016 to 2017.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.
Max Number of children born per woman about 1.88 was recorded at Year 2007
Min Number of children born per woman about 1.74 was recorded at Year 2017
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of children born per woman, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2007 to 2013.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2016 to 2017.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely constant which exists from 2015 to 2016.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2015.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely constant which exists from 2013 to 2014.
